uOvySrSg.question: For a given configuration, the stall speed of an aeroplane will be highest when loaded

options.text: to the maximum allowable mass with the most forward CG.
to a low total mass with the most forward CG.
to a low total mass with the most aft CG.
to the maximum allowable mass with the most aft CG.

X3SXPEpO.question: The effect of operating an aeroplane with a CG too far forward is to experience:

options.text: inability or difficulty in flaring on touchdown, resulting in nose-wheel landing first.
lower stick forces per G loading.
lower stalling speed.
inability or difficulty in trimming when flaps are retracted.

JGUDlaiH.question: When considering the effects of increased mass on an aeroplane, which of the following is true?

options.text: Stalling speeds will be higher.
Gradient of climb for a given power setting will be higher.
Stalling speeds will be lower.
Flight endurance will be increased.

mvlhhNdW.question: Fuel loaded onto an aeroplane is 15 400 kg but is erroneously entered into the load and trim sheet as 14 500 kg. This error is not detected by the flight crew but they will notice that:

options.text: speed at un-stick will be higher than expected.
V1 will be reached sooner than expected.
V1 will be increased.
the aeroplane will rotate much earlier than expected.

Q5rhrPV5.question: Which of the following is an advantage of having a trim tank in the horizontal stabiliser?

options.text: It allows the crew to keep the CG at an aft position.
It increases the structural mass.
It increases the efficiency of the elevator during slow flight.
It decreases the maximum range.

mf3BRAI4.question: Some aircraft are equipped with fuel trim tanks located in the aeroplane’s fin or horizontal stabiliser to actively manage CG position. Which of the following is an advantage of having a trim tank in the horizontal stabiliser?

options.text: It allows the crew to keep the CG at an aft position.
It increases the structural mass.
It decreases the maximum range.
It increases the efficiency of the elevator during slow flight.

LGKLiNwO.question: What happens when the centre of gravity (CG) is moved in a forward direction?

options.text: A reduction in rate of climb capability.
A reduction in the specific fuel consumption.
A decrease in induced drag.
A increase in rate of climb capability.

xRyQV3SQ.question: What happens if the CG is aft of the rear limit?

options.text: Stability decreases.
Stability increases.
Control forces will increase.
Controllability decreases.

GTJLjRsl.question: The mass displacement caused by landing gear extension:

options.text: creates a longitudinal moment in the direction (pitch-up or pitch-down) determined by the type of landing gear.
creates a pitch-down longitudinal moment.
does not create a longitudinal moment.
creates a pitch-up longitudinal moment.

V14Ehq6Y.question: When the centre of gravity is at the forward limit, an aeroplane will be:

options.text: extremely stable and will require excessive elevator control to change pitch.
extremely stable and require small elevator control to change pitch.
extremely unstable and require excessive elevator control to change pitch.
extremely unstable and require small elevator control to change pitch.

31jRhro4.question: What is the effect of a forward CG on the time to reach cruising altitude?

options.text: A forward CG decreases the maximum Rate of Climb and increases the time to reach cruising altitude.
The CG position has no impact on the Rate of Climb.
A forward CG allows the selection of a higher cruising altitude, therefore increases the time to reach cruising altitude.
A forward CG increases the maximum Rate of Climb and decreases the time to reach cruising altitude.

UWrDgizf.question: If the centre of gravity is near the forward limit, the aeroplane will:

options.text: require elevator trim, which will result in an increase in fuel consumption.
tend to over rotate during take-off.
benefit from reduced drag due to the decrease in angle of attack.
require less power for a given airspeed.

jzmEizMC.question: What is a possible consequence of loading an aircraft incorrectly so that the Centre of Gravity is positioned ahead of the forward limit?

options.text: There may be insufficient aft pitch control available to keep the aircraft level,
There may be insufficient forward pitch control available to keep the aircraft level.
There may be a tendency to over-pitch the aircraft during the flare just before landing.
The aircraft may become excessively manoeuvrable and beyond control.

VIJ5QtTi.question: What is a possible consequence of loading an aircraft incorrectly so that the Centre of Gravity is positioned ahead of the forward limit?

options.text: There may be insufficient aft pitch control available to keep the aircraft level.
There may be insufficient forward pitch control available to keep the aircraft level.
The aircraft may become excessively manoeuvrable and beyond control.
There may be a tendency to over-pitch the aircraft during the flare just before landing.

oySSD08G.question: What is a possible consequence of loading an aircraft incorrectly so that the Centre of Gravity is positioned ahead of the forward limit?

options.text: The aircraft becomes excessively stable and requires larger control inputs.
The aircraft may become excessively manoeuvrable and beyond control.
There may be insufficient forward pitch control available to keep the aircraft level.
There may be a tendency to over-pitch the aircraft during the flare just before landing.

TWSH5cvC.question: The operator can add (1) ___ to the CG limits, to be (2) ___.

options.text: (1) own limitations (2) more restrictive
(1) an additional 15 % margin (2) less restrictive
(1) an additional 15 % margin (2) more restrictive
(1) own limitations (2) less restrictive

8T3mJNT5.question: Why is it important to have accurate information about the airplane mass and CG position during flight?

options.text: It allows to select a real, optimum cruising level.
They are necessary for calculating take off and landing performance.
They are not important in commercial aviation as all data is provided.
It allows airlines to calculate the most efficient navigational route and costs.

QfcHHhPr.question:
Just prior to take-off, a baggage handler loads a heavy pallet with cargo into the forward hold without recording it in the Last Minute Changes (LMCs) section of the Mass & Balance documentation. What are the effects of this action?
1) V~MC~ will increase if the extra load is forward of the datum.
2) Stick forces in flight will decrease if the extra load is behind the datum.
3) Stick forces at V~R~ will increase.
4) V~MU~ will occur later.
5) The safe stopping distance will increase.
The answer regrouping all the correct statements is:

options.text: the distance from the datum to the centre of gravity of a mass.
the point on which a lever is supported, balanced, or about which it turns.
the distance from the centre of pressure to the centre of a mass.
the distance from the centre of gravity to the centre of a mass.

85nLDuXd.question: If the aircraft was loaded with the Centre of Gravity in front of the forward CG limit, counteracting the nose-pitching-down moment will lead to..

options.text: increased drag.
decreased required landing distances.
increased manoeuvrability.
a lower stalling speed.

aZQZvFQr.question: If the aircraft was loaded with the Centre of Gravity in front of the forward CG limit, counteracting the nose-pitching-down moment will lead to...

options.text: increased drag.
decreased required landing distances.
increased manoeuvrability.
a lower stalling speed.

K37qoY96.question: To assess aircraft performance, the pilot must...

options.text: know the planned take-off, en-route and landing mass, and any subsequent changes due to changes from the load and trim documentation.
only use the certified mass information from the Aircraft Flight Manual (AFM).
assess the actual zero fuel mass from the load and trim documentation and make sure that it does not exceed the certified limit.
know the mass of the aircraft at the previous landing and add a proper increment of fuel to the actual mass to get the correct values of uplifted fuel.

HzCs0yo1.question: For a given configuration, the stall speed of an aeroplane will be highest when loaded:

options.text: to the maximum allowable mass with the most forward CG.
to a low total mass with the most aft CG.
to a low total mass with the most forward CG.
to the maximum allowable mass with the most aft CG.

oiVxfUif.question: If an aeroplane has a higher mass than anticipated, for a given airspeed, the angle of attack will:

options.text: be greater, drag will increase and endurance will decrease.
remain constant, drag will increase and endurance will increase.
be decreased, drag will decrease and endurance will increase.
remain constant, drag will decrease and endurance will decrease.

m1MzGlcP.question: In which of the following situations must a pilot calculate the take-off mass and the centre of gravity and check the values against the limits?

options.text: Always before each flight
Always after each flight.
As soon as the load is different to the load from the last flight.
In predetermined intervals.

cWnKRPcB.question: In which of the following situations must a pilot calculate the take-off mass and the centre of gravity and check the values against the limits?

options.text: Always before each flight.
As soon as the load is different to the load from the last flight.
In predetermined intervals.
Always after each flight.

eef49zei.question: The handling and performance problems encountered with a CG too far aft include:

options.text: degradation or loss of nose-wheel steering.
improvement in nose-wheel steering.
no likelihood of a nose-up overbalance (on a tricycle gear aircraft) on the ground resulting in tail damage.
higher stick forces per G loading with no risk of over-stressing the airframe in manoeuvers.

GzwWcIfu.question: In cruise flight, a centre of gravity moving aft will:

options.text: decrease longitudinal static stability.
have no effect on longitudinal static stability.
increase longitudinal static stability.
not change the manoeuvrability.

CerFsViM.question: What are the effects on stability and controllability of a CG behind the aft limit? Longitudinal stability...

options.text: is reduced and controllability is increased.
is increased and controllability is reduced.
and controllability are increased.
and controllability are reduced.

7FZqhUy6.question: Following the acceptance of the Load Sheet and the Operational Flight Plan, the Commander decides to refuel his/her aircraft with 1618 US gallons at a specific gravity of 0.8. The fuel mass loaded on board is...

options.text: 754 lb

UOGTcaT0.question: If the CG is forward of the maximum forward CG limit, and if you compensate it with nose up action, the...

options.text: drag increases.
stall speed decreases.
fuel consumption decreases.
maneuverability increases.

MyZiEWWb.question: What is possible consequences of loading an aircraft incorrectly so that CG is positioned behind the aft limit?

options.text: There may be insufficient forward pitch control available to keep the aircraft level in straight flight.
The aircraft will be extremely stable.
There may be an inability to flare the aircraft on landing.
There may be insufficient aft pitch control available to keep the aircraft level in straight flight.
The quantity of matter in a body as measured by its inertia.
Weight × gravity.
The force exerted on a body by gravity.
None of the above.

yrzP1irf.question: A flight benefits from a strong tailwind which was not forecast.On arrival at destination a straight in approach and immediate landing clearance is given. The Landing Mass will be higher than planned and:

options.text: the landing distance will be required will be longer
the approach path will be steeper
the landing distance will be unaffected
the approach path will be steeper and threshold speed higher

eA7TW4Hi.question: A flight benefits from a strong tailwind which was not forecast. On arrival at destination a straight in approach and immediate landing clearance is given. The Landing Mass will be higher than planned and:

options.text: the landing distance required will be longer.
the landing distance will be unaffected.
the approach path will be steeper.
the approach path will be steeper and threshold speed higher.

WjAnmWdP.question: A flight benefits from a strong tailwind which was not forecast.On arrival at destination a straight in approach and immediate landing clearance is given.The Landing Mass will be higher than planned and:

options.text: the landing distance required will be longer.
the landing distance will be unaffected.
the approach path will be steeper and threshold speed higher.
the approach path will be steeper.

WaA7QlCy.question: For the purpose of completing the Mass and Balance documentation, the Operating Mass (OM) is considered to be Dry Operating Mass (DOM) plus

options.text: Take-off Fuel Mass.

VyTFit8W.question: Due to a mistake in the load sheet the aeroplane is 1 000 kg heavier than you believe it to be. As a consequence:

options.text: VMU will be higher.
V₁ will be higher.
V₁ , VMU and VR will all occur earlier.
VR will be higher.

tdf31Izs.question: To assess aircraft performance, the pilot must..

options.text: know the planned take-off, en-route and landing mass, and any subsequent changes from the load and trim documentation.
assess the actual zero fuel mass from the load and trim documentation and check that it does not exceed the certified limit.
know the mass of the aircraft at the previous landing and add the mass of the uplifted fuel.
only use the certified mass information from the Aircraft Flight Manual.

hXYr64yr.question: Which CG position is used when determining minimum control speeds in performance? A CG..

options.text: at the aft limit.
at the forward limit.

tLs2D2Up.question: The handling and performance problems encountered with a CG too far aft include

options.text: degradation or loss of nose-wheel steering.
improvement in nose-wheel steering.
no likelihood of a nose-up overbalance (on a tricycle gear aircraft) on the ground resulting in tail damage.
higher stick forces per G loading with no risk of over-stressing the airframe in manoeuvers.

tX7NEBA5.question: If the Centre of Gravity of an aeroplane moves forward during flight, the elevator control will become:

lighter making the aeroplane more easy to manoeuvre in pitch.
heavier making the aeroplane more easy to manoeuvre in pitch.
lighter making the aeroplane more difficult to manoeuvre in pitch.

UwlOCeSH.question: What are the effects of a CG in front of the forward limit? Range

options.text: and absolute ceiling decrease.
decreases and absolute ceiling increases.
increases and absolute ceiling decreases.
and absolute ceiling increase.

MXunlr9u.question: Refer to figure or CAP 696 file 2.1. Where is the datum of the aircraft located?

options.text: 97.0 inches forward of the mainwheels.
87.7 inches forward of the mainwheels.

39.0 inches aft of the firewall.

XJScShIM.question: Due to incorrect loading the centre of gravity (CG) of an airplane is located in front of the forward limit. What could be the consequence?

options.text: The available aft pitch control could be insufficient to keep the airplane in level flight.

An extremely manoeuvrable airplane beyond control.

d2BT7UzM.question: An aeroplane is loaded with its centre of gravity towards the rear limit. This will result in:

options.text: a reduction in power required for a given speed.
an increase in longitudinal stability.

RRex59Bw.question: If the CG is aft of the rear limit then:

options.text: Stability decreases.
Stability increases.

Controllability decreases.

gtm00RbU.question: With regard to the CG limits of an aircraft, which of the following is true?

options.text: The aircraft operator’s CG limitations can be more restrictive than the manufacturer’s CG limitations.

The manufacturer’s CG limitations can be more restrictive than the aircraft operator’s CG limitations.

aSg4MvAg.question: Comparing a forward CG position with an aft one, the forward CG position will cause a:

options.text: decrease in range.
tendency to yaw to the right on take-off.

2l6XsDX2.question: If the centre of gravity is further forward than the forward limit is, the aircraft’s horizontal surfaces have a..

shorter than usual moment arm and the drag is decreased.

qA8Gdc23.question: If the centre of gravity is further forward than the forward limit is, the aircraft’s horizontal surfaces have a...

options.text: longer than usual moment arm and the fuel consumption is increased.
longer than usual moment arm and the fuel consumption is decreased.
shorter than usual moment arm and the drag is decreased.
shorter than usual moment arm and the range is increased.

03IGOdez.question: If the centre of gravity of an aeroplane moves forward during flight the elevator control will:

options.text: become heavier making the aeroplane more difficult to manoeuvre in pitch.
become heavier making the aeroplane more easy to manoeuvre in pitch.
become lighter making the aeroplane more easy to manoeuvre in pitch.

GlDEDb9h.question: When does the centre of gravity position and Take-off Mass have to be calculated and checked against the limits?

options.text: Before each flight.

zwtoG46w.question: In cruise flight, an aft centre of gravity location will:

options.text: decrease longitudinal static stability.

nHg5f3x8.question: Prior to departure an aeroplane is loaded with 16 500 litres of fuel at a fuel density of 780 kg/m^3^. This is entered into the load sheet as 16 500 kg and calculations are carried out accordingly. As a result of this error, the aeroplane is:

options.text: lower with a forward centre of gravity position

higher with a forward centre of gravity position

PEooJVd6.question: If the CG is further forwards than the forward limit, the aircraft's horizontal surfaces have a...

options.text: Longer than usual moment arm and the fuel consumption is increased.
Longer than usual moment arm and the fuel consumption is decreased.
Shorter than usual moment arm and the drag is decreased.
Shorter than usual moment arm and the range is increased.

xlALd2Ku.question: When determining the minimum control speeds for an aeroplane, which of the following CG positions is used?

options.text: The aft CG limit.
An average CG position.
A CG location mid of the aft and forward limits.
The forward CG limit.

MT8wa9B0.question: Rush bags, late arrival bags, pilots? or cabin crew  baggage will be loaded as

options.text: bulk cargo
containerised cargo
palletised cargo
forbidden cargo

CvEImGdf.question: An additional baggage container is loaded into the aft cargo compartment but is not entered into the load and trim sheet. The aeroplane will be heavier than expected and calculated take-off safety speeds

options.text: Will give reduced safety margins
Will not be achieved
Will be greater than required
Are unaffected but V1 will increase

NHiRhTK2.question: An additional baggage container is loaded into the aft cargo compartment but is not entered into the load and trim sheet. The aeroplane will be heavier than expected and calculated take-off speeds...

options.text: will give reduced safety margins.
will be greater than required.
are unaffected but V1 will be increased.
will not be achieved.

dERzg2kY.question:
A pilot has finished the pre-planning
	Shortly before departure an additional container with a mass of 3 500 kg of traffic load is accepted
	The pilot forgets to calculate the new performance values of the aircraft
	Take-off and climb is accomplished without any problems
	How will the performance of the aircraft due to the additional mass be affected?

options.text: Rate of climb and range will be decreased.
Fuel flow and endurance will be reduced.
Angle of climb and obstacle clearance will be improved.
Fuel flow and specific range will be increased.

wgZKxfka.question: What are the possible consequences when loading an aircraft incorrectly so that its CG is positioned behind the aft limit?

options.text: There may be insufficient forward pitch control available to keep the aircraft level in straight flight.
There may be insufficient aft pitch control available to keep the aircraft level in straight flight.
The aircraft will be extremely stable.
There may be an inability to flare the aircraft on landing.

clctYuu7.question:
Aeroplane loading
A. must be performed under the supervision of qualified personnel
B. must be consistent with the data used for calculating the mass and balance
C. must comply with compartment dimension limitations
D. must comply with the maximum load per running metre
E. must comply with the maximum mass per cargo compartment

options.text: A, B, C, D and E
A , B , D and E
A and B
C D and E

xaiEDxpq.question:
Which statement is correct?

I. Stall speeds are determined with the CG at the forward limit. 
 II. Minimum control speeds are determined with the CG at the aft limit.

options.text: I is correct, II is correct.
I is correct, II is incorrect.
I is incorrect, II is correct.
I is incorrect, II is incorrect.

The traffic load is 770 kg
What is the Zero Fuel Mass is

maximum allowable mass with the most aft CG.

	Maximum Structural Landing Mass

vQrZuieV.question: Which of the following has to be expected with a CG in front of the forward limit?

options.text: An increase in aircraft drag.
A greater maximum endurance and range.
An increase in take-off distance and a reduction in landing distance.
Excessive longitudinal instability.

mvjoUArM.question: Which of the following has to be expected with a CG in front of the forward limit?

options.text: A reduction in aircraft ceiling.
A reduction of maximum range, but constant maximum endurance.
Static instability and increased maneuverability.
A reduction in total drag.

Yyr8nAk8.question: Overloading has the following effects on performance:

options.text: increased take-off and landing distance, reduced rate of climb and increased fuel consumption.
reduced take-off and landing distance, increased VNE and increased fuel consumption.
reduced take-off and landing distance, increased VNE and reduced rate of climb.
increased take-off and landing distance, increased rate of climb and increased fuel consumption.

5onAUV5B.question: Overloading has the following effects on performance:

options.text: Increased take off and landing distance, reduced rate of climb and increased fuel consumption
Reduced take off and landing distance, increased V~NE~ and increased fuel consumption
Increased take off and landing distance, increased rate of climb and increased fuel consumption
Reduced take off and landing distance, increased V~NE~ and reduced rate of climb

yxxFQqsL.question:
Which of the areas listed below fall within the scope of the Basic Regulation (Reg(EC) No 216/2008) on common rules in the field of civil aviation and establishing the European Aviation Safety Agency? 
1. Commercial Air Transport operations
2. Aerodrome operations
3. Unmanned aircraft with an operating mass 150 kg
4. Air Traffic Management organisations.

options.text: 1, 2 and 4
1, 2 and 3
1, 3 and 4
2, 3 and 4

fZ2LT5Hq.question: During take-off you notice that, for a given elevator input, the aeroplane rotates much more rapidly than expected. This is an indication that:

options.text: the centre of gravity may be towards the aft limit.
the centre of pressure is aft of the centre of gravity.
the aeroplane is overloaded.
the centre of gravity is too far forward.

C3tQVW9I.question: Which one of the following describes a possible handling and performance problem encountered with a CG too far aft?

options.text: Degradation or loss of nose-wheel steering.
Improvement in nose-wheel steering.
No likelihood of a nose-up overbalance (on a tricycle gear aircraft) on the ground resulting in tail damage.
Decreased tendency to skid.

auDAod6l.question: With regard to the Centre of Gravity limits of an aircraft, which one of the following statements is true?

options.text: The aircraft operator’s CG limitations can be more restrictive than the manufacturer’s CG limitations.
The CG limitations of the operator always have to be the same as the manufacturer’s limitations.
It depends on the state of registry whether the manufacturer’s or the aircraft operator’s limitations on CG are more restrictive.
The manufacturer’s CG limitations can be more restrictive than the aircraft operator’s CG limitations.

BQuMxZOe.question: If the centre of gravity is outside the forward limit in level and forward flight, the drag

options.text: increases, and endurance decreases.
increases, and endurance increases.
decreases, and the range decreases.
decreases, and the fuel consumption decreases.

o8lB2kAG.question: If the centre of gravity is further forward than the forward limit is, the aircraft horizontal surfaces have a..

options.text: longer than usual moment arm and the fuel consumption is increased.
longer than usual moment arm and the fuel consumption is decreased.
shorter than usual moment arm and the range is increased.
shorter than usual moment arm and the drag is decreased.

Pqs50A6x.question: The stalling speed of an aeroplane will be highest when it is loaded with a:

options.text: high gross mass and forward centre of gravity.
low gross mass and aft centre of gravity.
low gross mass and forward centre of gravity.
high gross mass and aft centre of gravity.

mng3u9OE.question: If an extra load is loaded into an aircraft, the stall speed is likely to

options.text: increase.
stay the same.
change depending on whether the load was placed FWD or AFT of the CG.
decrease.

uIVXUqAl.question: The Maximum Zero Fuel Mass (MZFM) is a structural limiting mass. It is made up of the aeroplane Dry Operating Mass (DOM) plus:

options.text: Traffic Load.
Traffic Load, unusable fuel and crew standard mass.
unusable fuel and crew standard mass.
Traffic Load and crew standard mass.

9gAnNDB2.question: What determines the longitudinal stability of an aeroplane ?

options.text: The location of the centre of gravity with respect to the neutral point.
The dihedral, angle of sweepback and the keel effect.
The relationship of thrust and lift to weight and drag.
The effectiveness of the horizontal stabilizer, rudder and rudder trim tab.

E8FTltTs.question: What determines the longitudinal stability of an aeroplane?

options.text: The location of the centre of gravity with respect to the neutral point.
The dihedral, angle of sweepback and the keel effect.
The effectiveness of the horizontal stabilizer, rudder and rudder trim tab.
The relationship of thrust and lift to weight and drag.

YSC0Mygo.question: With the centre of gravity (CG) on the forward limit which of the following is to be expected?

options.text: A decrease in range.
A decrease of the stalling speed.
A decrease in the landing speed.
A tendency to yaw to the right on take-off.

N4fg6M1Q.question: For the following see-saw to be in balance

options.text: Fc = Fa ÷ 3
Fc = 3 ÷ Fa

QjwkV1j6.question: Which of the following is most likely to affect the range of centre of gravity positions on an aeroplane?

options.text: Elevator and tailplane (horizontal stabilizer) effectiveness in all flight conditions.
The need to maintain a low value of stalling speed.

options.text: The effectiveness of elevator and tailplane (horizontal stabilizer) in all flight conditions.
The need to maintain low stalling speed.
The location of the undercarriage.
The need to minimize drag forces and improve efficiency.

5TFwbYW7.question: For a given aeroplane mass, a more aft CG position will..

options.text: decrease the take-off distance and improve the take-off climb performance.
increase the take-off distance and reduce the take-off climb performance.
decrease the take-off distance and reduce the take-off climb performance.
increase the take-off distance and improve the take-off climb performance.

options.text: increased cruise range.

RacCOglY.question: Assuming gross mass, altitude and airspeed remain unchanged, movement of the centre of gravity from the forward to the aft limit will cause...

options.text: increased cruise range.
lower optimum cruising speed.
higher stall speed.
reduced maximum cruise range.

phKX3apx.question: What is the effect if the centre of gravity is behind the aft limit in level and forward flight?

options.text: The stability is decreased.
The control forces are decreased.
The controllability is increased.

zJUQ3vKO.question: What is the effect if the centre of gravity is behind the aft limit in level and forward flight?

options.text: The stability is decreased.
